data.name: Cycle in a Linked List
data.description:
A cycle in a linked list is a section of the linked list that forms a loop such that when traversing the linked list, one can pass through the same node more than once (an infinite number of times)

In this kata, you will write a function to determine if there is a cycle in a given linked list using O(1) space.

For example:

```
1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 This linked list has a cycle containing nodes 3, 4, 5, and 6.
          ^    |
          |    V
          6 <- 5

          
1 -> 2           This linked list also has a cycle containing nodes 1, 2, 3, and 4.
^    | 
|    V
4 <- 3

1 -> 2 -> 3      This linked list does not contain a cycle.

1 -> 2 -> 3 -    This linked list does contain a cycle (self-loop on element 3)
          ^   |
          |   |
            -
```
            
* NOTE: Do not modify the linked list you are given, the same list may be slightly modified and reused between tests. *
